text: Uthman ibn Hunaif was one of the companions of Muhammad. According to Shia belief, he did not give allegiance to Abu Bakr, until Ali supposedly did so.Peshawar Nights on Al-Islam.org He narrated the Hadith of the blind man.Islam Tomorrow .com Qadi Yusuf says that Uthman bin Hunaif was an authority in all Arabia on taxation, assessment of land revenue and land reclamation. He was employed by Umar as a land revenue expert.A Restatement of the History of Islam and Muslims on Al-Islam.org , referencing Kitabul-Kharaj and Siyar-ul-Ansar He was appointed governor of Basra by Ali. ==References== Category:Sahabah who participated in the battle of Uhud
title: Uthman ibn Hunaif
